summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, granting the Government's request to file a motion to preclude certain cross-examination under seal to protect witness privacy. The order requires the defendant to respond by a specific deadline on the same day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order granting the Government's request to file a motion under seal and setting a response deadline for the defendant.

events.title: Court Order on Sealed Motion
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan grants the Government's request to file a letter motion to preclude certain lines of cross-examination under seal to protect witness privacy and orders the defendant to respond by 2:00 p.m. the same day.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Government filed a motion to preclude certain lines of cross-examination of Government witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the Government's request to file this motion under seal to protect the privacy of anticipated witnesses, including those under a pseudonym order.
The defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, was ordered to respond to the motion by 2:00 p.m. on November 28, 2021.
The court cites the legal precedent Lugosch v. Pyramid Co. of Onondaga to support sealing the motion.
The document indicates ongoing pre-trial litigation concerning witness protection and the scope of cross-examination.
